intro: Chevaliera muricata, commonly known as the spiny poinsettia, is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its dark green, spiny leaves and striking red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. The bracts, which are not true flowers, are often used in festive decorations, especially during the holiday season.
